intro: Acronychia minahassae, commonly known as the Minahassa acronychia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Burseraceae. It is native to Indonesia, specifically found in the provinces of South Sulawesi and Southeast Sulawesi. The plant is a small to medium-sized tree, typically reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a rough texture with a distinctive reddish or purple coloration on the underside. The flowers are small and clustered, producing a unique aromatic scent that attracts pollinators.
